title: Cardiff Bus strike begins for 48 hours
text:
Cardiff Bus’ Unite union members are on strike for 48 hours today following a workplace ballot, after a pay offer by the bus operator was rejected.
Cardiff Bus will be operating a limited bus service until midnight on Friday, October, 2.
They're advising customers to check routes for any changes or special services before they travel.
Following the result of a workplace ballot, Unite union members have unfortunately rejected our latest improved offer and decided to strike for 48 hours commencing Thursday 1st October.
We have continued to work tirelessly to reach a positive resolution for all parties involved and are extremely disappointed that this has not been achieved.
We are extremely apologetic for again inconveniencing our customers, and we will do our best to ensure that we keep Cardiff moving during this time.
– Cynthia Ogbonna, Managing Director, Cardiff Bus Cardiff Bus' latest offer to workers was to increase the pay award to 2.5% for one year and maintain the attendance bonus.
But Unite says it warned the company that members were unlikely to accept the offer:
Our members at Cardiff Bus have been forced into industrial action by the employer’s refusal to enter into meaningful negotiations.
We advised Cardiff Bus that their marginally improved pay offer was unlikely to be accepted by our members and, following their ballot, this has been confirmed.
Our members do not take industrial action on a whim, nor do they want to see the general public inconvenienced.
However, industrial action is the only means that they have with which they can try to persuade the employer to reconsider their position.
– Alan McCarthy, Regional Industrial Organiser Last updated Thu 1 Oct 2015 Travel Cardiff Wales
